edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib
Class Router

java.lang.Object
  edu.washington.cs.cse490h.lib.Router

public class Router
extends java.lang.Object

 
 Simply routes packets in the network and stores queued packets to failed
 nodes. It works by listening for new TCP connections. The Router sends the
 address that the emulated node should use and forks off a new thread to deal
 with the connection.
 
 Usage: java Router [options]
 
 General Options:
   -h --help=    - Print usage message [default false]
   -v --version= - Print program version [default false]
 
 Execution Options:
   -p --localPort=   - Local UDP port [default -1]

Method Detail

start

protected void start()
Start up the Router. It sits and listens for new connections, and spawns a new thread for each one.

exit

protected void exit()
Stop the Router

nodeQuit

protected void nodeQuit(int address,
                        java.util.LinkedList<Packet> queue)
Called by an emulated node to signal that it is quitting

Parameters:
address - The virtual address of the node that is quitting
queue - The queue of in-transit packets gotten from the termination protocol. Can be empty.

nodeJoin

private void nodeJoin(int address,
                      EmulatedNode newNode)
Called by the start thread to create a new emulated node

Parameters:
address - The virtual address of the new node
newNode - The new emulated node object

freeAddr

private int freeAddr()
Gets the next available address. Even without locking, this guarantees the address is free since joins are only handled in this thread. The returned address is not guaranteed to be the lowest free address however

Returns:
The next available address, or -1 if there are no more free addresses

portConflict

private NodeContainer portConflict(java.net.InetAddress ipAddress,
                                   int port)
Check if there is already a node using a specific IP and port.

Parameters:
ipAddress - The IP address of the machine on which the node is running
port - The port that the node is using
Returns:
A node container that is using the same IP/port, or null if it does not exist
